page.title: 10THE SHOPS OF NEWICK
page.content: A strange change has occured to the shops of Newick, since the beginning of the 20th century. Then, as now, they were mostly clustered around the Green, but considering the enormous growth of the population, they have decreased in number, rather than increased. Then there were 2 grocers (both selling furniture, lino and china as well as food), a shoe-mender, a hairdresser, 3 butchers, a tailor, 2 laundries, a wheelwright, 2 bakers, 3 blacksmiths and a Post Office. There were also many local industries such as glove-making (famous nationally), wagon-making, brewing, building, etc. Today there are just 2 grocers, a DIY shop, a baker, a butcher, a florist, a bank, a chemist and 3 estate agents! The main reason for this change is that most people now drive to large supermarkets in bigger towns.
